column4: What is the extension of executables in Linux (In Windows it would be .exe) also how can I find where the executable file of a program icon that is in the application menu (In Windows I would right click on the icon and in the properties it would tell me where the the file is on the hard drive)
we don't use filename extensions generally
.deb is the extension for Debian packages, which contain software distributions; the actual executables generally have no extension
instead, every Linux file has an "executable bit"; you can check whether it's set or not using the command "file <filename>"
